DOC.brief_summary: The study non-randomized , multi-center safety feasibility trial Aneufix ACP-T5 treat patient Isolated type II endoleak presence non-shrinking AAA sac follow EVAR procedure .
DOC.brief_title: Feasibility Study ANEUFIX : Novel Approach Treat Type II Endoleaks Using ACP-T5
DOC.detailed_description: The investigational device call Aneufix , specifically model ACP-T5 , product treat endoleak blockage backflowing blood vessel , i.e . fill 'endoleak void nidus feed artery exit exist drain artery ' .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Persistent type IIa IIb endoleak ( 6 month postEVAR postembolization procedure ) ; AND 2 . Volume 'endoleak void ' determine upfront ; AND 3 . An EVAR without circulatory complication ; AND 4 . An endoleak confirm CT scan precede 6 week demonstrate high likelihood isolated nature endoleak ; AND 5 . An aneurysm sac either grow contour EVAR ( per European Guidelines ) stable size ( nonshrinking sac ) document precede 6 week mean echo ( alternative visualization technique ) ; AND 6 . An aneurysm sac puncture translumbar approach ; AND 7 . Possibility withhold antithrombogenic medication temporarily ; AND 8 . Ability willingness undergo translumbar procedure local anesthesia CT scan ; AND 9 . Be old 45 year . 1 . Patient able willing give write Informed Consent ; OR 2 . Patient undergoing emergency procedure ; OR 3 . Patient traumatic vascular injury ; OR 4 . Patient hemostatic disorder clinically unstable ; OR 5 . Patient high risk abdominal sac rupture allow safe radiological scanographic assessment ; OR 6 . Patient allergic contrast medium anticoagulant ; OR 7 . Patient renal impairment ( serum creatinine > 2 mg/dl > 176 mmol/l ) ; OR 8 . Patient participate another trial investigational drug medical device ; OR 9 . Patient life expectancy le 12 month .
